alert.note: Alert for South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 9:57PM MDT until April 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR TUESDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW HUMIDITY, WARMER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND DEEP INSTABILITY... Strong winds and dry conditions will create Red Flag Warning conditions on Tuesday due to an approaching upper level storm system. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 055, 056, 111, AND 112... * WIND...West-southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 60 mph. * HUMIDITY...10-15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Be careful with anything that might cause sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands
